philosophy.title: Yin and Yang Philosophy
philosophy.content: Yin and Yang are fundamental concepts from ancient Chinese philosophy, representing two opposing but complementary forces. Yin represents darkness, cold, and softness; Yang represents light, heat, and strength. They depend on each other and constantly transform, forming the basis of everything in the universe.

practice.title: Tai Chi Practice
practice.content: Tai Chi Chuan originates from traditional Chinese philosophy and emphasizes the principle of 'soft overcoming hard' and 'response to action'. Through slow, flowing movements, harmony between body and mind is achieved, reflecting what Taoism calls 'doing through not doing'.

health.title: Health and Wellness
health.content: Tai Chi combines movement, breathing, and meditation, helping to improve body balance, increase muscle strength, and reduce stress. Research shows that regular practice of Tai Chi can boost immunity and improve cardiovascular health.

quote.text: "Tai Chi generates Yin and Yang, Yin and Yang generate the four phenomena, the four phenomena generate the eight trigrams"
quote.author: — I Ching (Book of Changes)
